titleStmt.title: Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art, F1930.24

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: Freer Gallery of Art , Washington DC

summary.p: One folio on parchment; Shelfmark: F1930.24; Qur'ānic text: Q 38:66-69; Seven lines per page; F1930.24 and fourteen other fragments from the Freer Gallery of Art collection, one fragment from the Library of Congress, one fragment from the Cleveland Museum of Art and one fragment from the Los Angeles County Museum of Art originally belonged to the same codex; Script style: kūfī, type D.I; estimated date of production: 750-900 (?).
The list of the sister folios discovered so far, arranged according to the Qurʾānic tex:

p.ref: (1) Q 38:29-31; F1930.70, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.

p.hi: (2) Q 38:66-69; F1930.24, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.

p.ref: (3) Q 38:75-80; 1933.493, Cleveland, The Cleveland Museum of Art.
(4) Q 38:80-86; F1930.66, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(5) Q 38:87-39:2; F1930.60, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(6) Q 39:10-14; S1997.91, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(7) Q 48:5-6; F1930.23, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(8) Q 48:7-9; F1930.64, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(9) Q 48:10; F1930.69, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.

summary.p: (10) Q 48:10-11; AL-7, Washington DC, Library of Congress.

p.ref: (11) Q 48:11-13; F1930.65, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(12) Q 48:15-16; F1930.61, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(13) Q 48:26-27; F1930.63, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(14) Q 48:27-29; F1930.62, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(15) Q 49:2; F1930.68, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(16) Q 49:10-11; S1997.90, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(17) Q 49:12; F1930.67, Washington DC, Freer Gallery of Art.
(18) Q 50:14-16; M.73.5.502, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

summary.p: Cf. also website of the institution: https://asia.si.edu/object/F1930.24/

support.p: Fol. 1 recto is hair side, fol. 1 verso is flesh side.

Text division: Simple verse separator consists of a group of six dots arranged in a triangle in gold ink, in some cases the dots are outlined in brown ink. Fifth verse separator is marked with the letter hāʾ as a pear-shaped, gold-painted ornament with a hint of green. Tenth verse separator consists of a golden medallion containing the numeral, e.g. the word ṯamānūn for the 80. verse. The beginning of a Sūrah is marked with an ornament with vegetal motifs in gold and green ink, the name of the new Sūrah with the number of verses is written on the line.

scriptDesc.summary: Vocalisation is given by red, yellow, green and blue ink. Diacritical marks are missing. Script: Most letter forms resemble with the kūfī D.I group. The independent ʾalif has more resemblance to the script style kūfī D.II.
